Key Arguments: The legislation goes against Australian values of free speech.
Social media platforms themselves have been sources of misinformation.
The bill could lead to suppression of balanced news and free speech, akin to propaganda in authoritarian regimes.
Recent history shows that suppressed opinions have sometimes been proven correct.
The proposed legislation is an overreach of government power.
Notable Quotes: Every Australian should have the right to read, watch and say what they want without being told what is right and wrong by the government or big tech.
If this draft bill passes we will be more suppressed by lack of balanced news, science and facts, isnâ€™t this what communist regimes and dictatorships do.

Ironically most of the silenced opinions from experts in their respective fields have proven to be correct and true whilst the official news and information pushed by government and mainstream media at the time has proven to be flawed, false and misleading.
